column2: MAINE DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 2. Drivers should adjust their rearview and side mirrors:
column4: whenever they need to use them.
column8: before they get into the car.

column2: 3. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
column4: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
column6: stop until all the children have left the bus.
column8: stop until the lights stop flashing.

column2: 4. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column8: accelerate quickly.
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 5. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column8: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 6. Before entering a curve, you should:
column8: reduce your speed.

column2: 7. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: switch to daytime lights.
column10: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Stop if necessary

column2: 9. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column6: slow down when roads are wet.
column8: stay away from puddles and standing water.

column2: 10. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column8: Drivers who are fatigued.

column2: 11. At night, it is hardest to see:
column8: pedestrians.

column2: 12. At times even driving 10 MPH is too fast for existing conditions.
13. This road sign means:
column8: No left turn

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Steep grade ahead

column2: 15. When passing a motorcycle, you must:
column4: have your vehicle entirely into the left lane before and during the pass.
column6: honk your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: speed up above the speed limit and use your emergency lights to alert the motorcyle that you are about to pass.

column2: 16. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 17. When parallel parking between two cars, you should first:
column4: turn your wheels to the left.
column6: turn your wheels to the right.
column8: pull up even with the front car.

column2: 18. Motorcycles:
column4: are easier to see than cars.
column6: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.

column2: 19. When driving in work zones you should:
column4: gradually come to a complete stop and wait for a flagger to guide traffic safely through the work zone.
column8: carefully watch for workers and moving equipment.

column2: 20. Stopping distances:
column6: are not affected by vehicle speed.
column8: increase as vehicle speed increases.

column2: 21. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column8: be in the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 22. You come to an intersection where your view to the side is blocked. What should you do?
column4: maintain your speed and look both ways.
column6: slow down and look both ways.
column8: Stop, then inch forward until you can see clearly in both directions.

column2: 23. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 24. When turning, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to improve stability.
column8: always move to the right lane.

column2: 25. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column8: Better concentration

column2: 26. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.

column2: 27. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column8: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.
column10: only if the other driver signals it is safe.

column2: 28. You should always travel:
column6: according to weather and road conditions.
column8: at the speed of the vehicle behind.

column2: 29. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column6: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column8: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column10: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 30. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 31. Increasing your vehicle’s speed _____ your field of vision.
column8: increases

column2: 32. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
33. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column8: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column8: Keep left

column2: 35. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 36. This traffic sign warns you about:
column8: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 37. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column8: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 38. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column6: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column8: has no effect, they are different substances.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 39. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column8: only on the left and right side

column2: 40. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column6: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column8: pull to the curb and stop.
column10: speed up and take the nearest exit.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column6: You have the right of way
column8: Yield the right-of-way
column10: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching

column2: 42. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: closely follow the driver in front of them.
column6: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: maintain their speed through the work zone.

column2: 43. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column8: vehicles

column2: 44. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column6: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column8: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column10: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 46. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 47. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road

column2: 48. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: require more space for turning movements.

column2: 49. Many crashes are caused by:
column8: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.
column10: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.

column2: 50. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column8: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 51. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: tailgate the driver in front of you.
column8: drive above the posted speed limit.

column2: 52. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
column6: be ready to sound the horn.
column8: increase the following distance.

column2: 53. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column8: low beam headlights.

column2: 54. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column8: waiting several hours.

column2: 55. This road sign means:
column8: Side road

column2: 56. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 57. This road sign means:
column8: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 58. The most common cause of traffic crashes is:
column8: human error.

column2: 59. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
column6: pedestrians are crossing at an intersection without a traffic light and without a crosswalk.
column8: All of the above.
column10: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.

column2: 60. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the right may pass.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: passing is not permitted in either direction.
